unnormalised: Seriously though, before you hand over your hard-earned Rs. to some builder promising the moon, do your homework! Check online reviews – platforms like Magicbricks and NoBroker are good starting points. But don't just blindly believe everything you read.

unnormalised: Look for recurring themes. Are people consistently complaining about delayed possession? Poor construction quality (like leaky roofs or shoddy plumbing)? Or maybe the dreaded hidden charges? Things like the 'clubhouse membership fee' suddenly popping up after you've signed on the dotted line.

unnormalised: Also, try to find reviews from actual residents. Not just anonymous posts, but people who have been living in the property for at least 6 months to a year. They'll give you the real scoop on things like maintenance issues, water supply problems, and whether the promised "green area" is actually just a patch of dried-up grass.
